com.st.BlueSTSDK

Class Manager

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.st.BlueSTSDK.Manager

  • public class Manager
extends java.lang.Object
    Singleton class that manage the discovery of new BLE nodes

    The ManagerListener method will be called asynchronous inside a different thread. It is safe to remove the listener form inside a callback

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static interface  Manager.ManagerListener
      Interface used by this class for notify that a new node is discovered or that the scanning start/stop

    • Method Detail

      • getSharedInstance

        public static Manager getSharedInstance()
        return a singleton instance of the manager
        Returns:
        an instance of Manager

      • startDiscovery

        public boolean startDiscovery()
        start a discovery process

        The scanning will run until you don't call stopDiscovery()

        Returns:
        true if the process is started, false if it is already running

      • startDiscovery

        public boolean startDiscovery(int timeoutMs)
        start a discovery process, that will automatically stop after timeoutMs milliseconds
        Parameters:
        timeoutMs - time to wait before stop the discovery process.
        Returns:
        true if the process is started, false if a discovery is already running

      • addVirtualNode

        public void addVirtualNode()
        Add a fake Node to the list

      • addNode

        public boolean addNode(Node newNode)
        insert a node into this manager, the addition will be notify to all the listener
        Parameters:
        newNode - node to add
        Returns:
        true if the node is added, false if a node with the same tag is present

      • stopDiscovery

        public boolean stopDiscovery()
        stop a discovery process
        Returns:
        true if the discovery is stopped, false if there are no running discovery process

      • isDiscovering

        public boolean isDiscovering()
        Returns:
        true if the manager is scanning for find new nodes, false otherwise

      • resetDiscovery

        public void resetDiscovery()
        stop the discovery process and remove all the already discovered nodes. the node that are bounded with the device will be kept in the list

      • addListener

        public void addListener(Manager.ManagerListener listener)
        add a listener for the event send by the manager
        Parameters:
        listener - class where notify the manager events

      • removeListener

        public void removeListener(Manager.ManagerListener listener)
        remove the listener
        Parameters:
        listener - listener to remove

      • getNodeWithTag

        @Nullable
public Node getNodeWithTag(java.lang.String tag)
        if present return the node with that specific tag
        Parameters:
        tag - unique string that identify a node
        Returns:
        the node with that tag or null if is not present on the list of the discovered node

      • getNodeWithName

        @Nullable
public Node getNodeWithName(java.lang.String name)
        if present it return a node with that name

        Note: the name is not unique, we will return the fist node that match the name

        Note: the match is case sensitive

        Parameters:
        name - name of the device
        Returns:
        the device with that name or null otherwise

      • getNodes

        public java.util.List<Node> getNodes()
        get the list of all the discovered node

        Node: The list is unmodifiable, calling add will throw an exception

        Returns:
        the list of all the discovered node until that time

      • addFeatureToNode

        public static void addFeatureToNode(byte deviceId,
                                    android.util.SparseArray<java.lang.Class<? extends Feature>> features)
                             throws InvalidFeatureBitMaskException
        register a new device id or add feature to an already defined device

        the change will affect only the node discover after this call

        Parameters:
        deviceId - device type that will use the feature, it can be a new device id
        features - array of feature that we will add, the index of the feature will be used as feature mask. the feature mask must have only one bit to 1
        Throws:
        InvalidFeatureBitMaskException - throw when a feature is a position that is not a power of 2

      • isValidDeviceId

        public static boolean isValidDeviceId(byte deviceId)
        check if a deviceId is recognize as valid
        Parameters:
        deviceId - device id to test
        Returns:
        true if the user register this device as valid,

      • getNodeFeatures

        public static android.util.SparseArray<java.lang.Class<? extends Feature>> getNodeFeatures(byte deviceId)
        get a copy Features available for the deviceId
        Parameters:
        deviceId - device type that will use the feature, it can be a new device id
        Returns:
        null if the deviceId is not registered else the list of available feature for that deviceId
